title: 'Maleficent 2': Angelina Jolie sequel (barely) takes down 'Joker'
text:
CLOSE Disney's live-action “Maleficent: Mistress of Evil” is a fantasy adventure that picks up several years after “Maleficent.” Disney

LOS ANGELES – Disney's "Maleficent: Mistress of Evil" has knocked "Joker" out of the No. 1 spot at the box office, but just barely.

Studios on Sunday estimate that the film starring Angelina Jolie grossed $36 million in North America and $117 million internationally in its first weekend in theaters. The first film had a much stronger domestic showing, opening to nearly $70 million in 2014.

"Joker" landed in second place in its third weekend with $29.2 million. The villain origin story has grossed more than $247 million domestically.

Third place went to another sequel, "Zombieland: Double Tap," with $26.7 million. The R-rated comedy comes 10 years after the original.

Angelina Jolie toes the line between hero and villain in "Maleficent: Mistress of Evil." (Photo: DISNEY)

Rounding out the rest of the top five: The animated version of "The Addams Family," starring the voices of Charlize Theron and Oscar Isaac, finished fourth with $16.1 million, and Will Smith's "Gemini Man" was fifth with $8.5 million.

And in limited release, Taika Waititi's Nazi satire "Jojo Rabbit" opened in five theaters with a strong $350,000.

Final numbers are expected Monday.

Contributing: Kim Willis, USA TODAY

Read or Share this story: https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/movies/2019/10/20/maleficent-2-angelina-jolie-barely-takes-down-joker-box-office/4045444002/
description: Angelina Jolie's 'Maleficent: Mistress of Evil' managed to defeat Joaquin Phoenix's 'Joker,' but it wasn't a huge win. 'Zombieland 2' finished third.
